SEARCH
Package game.body.walkers

Class PlayerWalker

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
city.cs.engine.Walker
game.body.walkers.WalkerFrame
game.body.walkers.PlayerWalker
public final class PlayerWalker extends WalkerFrame
The core class for the player. It handles the player's movement, health, and interactions with the game world. It also manages the player's attack sensors and the mobs within their range.
Since:
03-02-2025
Author:
Alexander Smolowitz, alexander.smolowitz@city.ac.uk

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerWalker

      public PlayerWalker(GameWorld gameWorld)
      Initializes the player with a specified game world. Sets up the necessary fixtures, sensors and listeners.
      Parameters:
      gameWorld - The GameWorld object representing the game world.

  • Method Details

    • makePlayerSolid

      public void makePlayerSolid()
      Makes the player solid, allowing them to interact with the game world. This is called when the player is ghostly. Calls the super method WalkerFrame.makeSolid()

    • makePlayerGhostly

      public void makePlayerGhostly()
      Makes the player ghostly, allowing them to pass through the game world. This is called when the player is solid. Calls the super method WalkerFrame.makeGhostly()

    • checkMob

      public void checkMob()
      Checks the mobs in the attack sensors. This is called when the player attacks. It removes any mobs that are no longer intersecting the sensor.

    • hurtMob

      public void hurtMob()
      Plays the attack sound effect, starts a timer with a delay of 100 ms. when the timer ends, it checks the direction of the player, and then hurts all mobs in the corresponding sensor.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage, String attacker)
      Toggles the onHit animation for the player, deducts health points, and checks for death. Outputs debug information to the console.
      Parameters:
      damage - The amount of damage taken.
      attacker - The name of the attacker, or just an attacker message.

    • getHealthPoints

      public int getHealthPoints()
      gets the health points of the player.
      Returns:
      the health points value

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      gets the player's max health points.
      Returns:
      the MAX_HEALTH constant

    • outOfBounds

      public void outOfBounds(String deathMessage)
      Checks if the player is out of the level bounds. If so, it checks whether the player fell to death or merely went out of bounds, then calls the #blackScreenDeath(String) method with the appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      deathMessage - the appropriate death message

    • isHealthFull

      public boolean isHealthFull()
      checks if the player's health is equal to the MAX_HEALTH constant
      Returns:
      true if the health points are equal to the max health

    • die

      public void die()
      Sets a death image, ends the game, and removes the step listener.
      Overrides:
      die in class WalkerFrame
      See Also:
      • SoundFX

    • jump

      public void jump(float speed)
      If the player is on a valid surface Sets the player to jump with a speed of 10. It also plays the jump sound effect.
      Overrides:
      jump in class city.cs.engine.Walker
      Parameters:
      speed - The speed of the jump.

    • startWalking

      public void startWalking(float speed)
      Calls the super Walker.startWalking(float) method. Plays the running sound effect.
      Overrides:
      startWalking in class city.cs.engine.Walker
      Parameters:
      speed - The speed of the walk.

    • stopWalking

      public void stopWalking()
      Calls the super Walker.stopWalking() method. Stops the running sound effect.
      Overrides:
      stopWalking in class city.cs.engine.Walker

    • isOnSurface

      public boolean isOnSurface()
      Checks if the player is on a valid surface. This is used to prevent jumping on surfaces. Uses special cases when needed for specific instances of GroundFrame.
      Returns:
      true if the player is on a valid surface

    • addHealthPoints

      public void addHealthPoints(int healthPoints)
      adds health points to the player's health field
      Parameters:
      healthPoints - the number of health points to add

    • addStrength

      public void addStrength(int strength)
      adds damage to the player's damage field
      Parameters:
      strength - the number of damage points to add

    • removeStrength

      public void removeStrength(int strength)
      removes damage from the player's damage field
      Parameters:
      strength - the number of damage points to remove

    • getDamage

      public int getDamage()
      gets the player's damage field value
      Returns:
      the damage value

    • getSupportedStates

      public static State[] getSupportedStates()
      Gets the list of supported states for a player.
      Returns:
      An array of supported states.
      See Also:
      • State
